bibl.note: This is a letter from Abram Bradley to A. Fergusson, dated February 16, 1847. Bradley writes Fergusson that he needs and wants to see him very much. It has to do with some money. Bradley requests that Fergusson come to his home in Gallatin

div.p:
I received you favor of
Jany January 1st have been looking out to See you at my Dwelling but you have not come there and attended at Feby Term and am now in Gallatin and am making enquiry for you Learned that
Col Colonel McDonnald was in Town and on Seeing him he informed me that you are gone to Nashville I had hope to See you at this Term of the Court I do not entertain any uneasiness about the matter myself but the old Lady is like a great many other old persons impatient and chidish childish and She wishes the matter attended to as Soon as you Possably Possibly can it my be that you my come to Galatin before this Term expires and if I knew whento when to meet you I would do so please come to my house if you come to Galatin but if your business is Such that you cannot come to my House please leave the money in the hands of J. W. Bauldredge
Esqr Esquire your compliance with the above will Confer a favour favor on your Friend &c and etcetera

closer.add:
P. S. Post Script I would like
verry very much to See you at my Dwelling A. B.
